website_summaries.verdict: You get 4 locks of different colors for this price, allowing you to keep track of a variety of lock combinations.
pros: Includes a red TSA inspection indicator, which lets you know when it has been opened with a master key
Numbers on the dial are easy to read
cons: The shackle on this lock is a little short
Test the locks well before you put them on your bags

customer_reviews.title: Works as long as TSA does not access
customer_reviews.text: The initial impression I got from these locks was great. They felt very solid and setting up the combination was an easy process. I then set off on vacation with my family in which every one of these locks that was opened by the TSA became unusable again. My combination no longer works on any of them and the TSA open indicator is showing. The one lock that was not opened by the TSA still works but the others are now junk. What good is a combination lock if the combination stops working whenever the TSA touched it??
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Bought a 4 pack of locks. Two I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 4 pack of locks. First impression was that the locks are more ruggedly constructed than most luggage locks I've had. Setting the combo wasn't difficult. Two I was able to easily set the combination. Two locks not able to set a combination. Both seemed to be defective. Wrote to vendor. Received an immediate response from vendor to replace the defective locks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I really like this lock
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lock. I've broken down the advantages and disadvantages here: Advantages: 1) The locks feel really solid. They're made out of metal rather than plastic so their much sturdier than other locks. 2) The pop up indicator is a useful feature for letting you know when you've been inspected. 3) The dials are easy to read. 4) The packaging they come in is sturdy and includes clear instructions. Disadvantages: 1) They only use three digits. I would prefer a four digit lock Overall, I would highly recommend these locks.
customer_reviews.author: Tim L. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: fortunately it didn't fall off) and we couldn't figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for travel cases containing computer equipment. The shank is a bit short and a little difficult to insert through the locking tab on my luggage (Pelican AirCase). I had 2 identical cases and TSA only opened one of them. The one they DID open was left unlocked (the lock just hanging on the luggage, fortunately it didn't fall off) and we couldn't figure out why, until we tried to re-lock it and were unable to. The combination no longer worked. I'm hoping that Forge can instruct me how to reset it...
customer_reviews.author: L Hood

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. The TSA have not heard about it.
customer_reviews.text: I got them a while ago and thought they will never be put to the test. Well I was proven wrong on my first trip to the USA my luggage got delayed and upon arrival I found out that the locks were cut by the TSA and a note added that my luggage had to be searched. Bottom line if companies want to introduce a new concept they do there campaign properly and inform the TSA that there is a universal key that opens these locks.
customer_reviews.author: Dany Dagher

customer_reviews.title: Cannot set combination on any of the 4 locks
customer_reviews.text: Received the green four pack yesterday. I have read all the instructions and viewed the videos on Amazon's website and the vendors website as well as the hints and tricks shown on this website, but have been unable to set the combination on all four locks. The shackle will not rotate back the second 90 degrees. I have tried for an hour with no luck. Two other friends have also tried unsuccessfully to set the combination. I have emailed the company to see if this could be a batch defect or if there's any additional tricks otherwise I will return them the Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: pbarb

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and nice to have 4 at a time (give 1 or 2 as gifts if you don't need them all)
customer_reviews.text: Great value and features. Feels more heavy-duty than I was expecting (at first I thought the shaft may not even go through the little holes in the zipper pull made for locks but it easily did). It is easy to change the combination (but not obvious, so you may want to save the instructions). Some cool features like the red pop-out indicator that tells you if TSA opened it with their key (that resets automatically when you "legitimately" open it with the combination), and the feature that forces TSA to relock the lock rather than being sloppy about it as they all too often are (they can't take their key out till they relock it).
customer_reviews.author: sminla

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock but........
customer_reviews.text: I would give this lock 4 1/2 stars but one of the locks was screwy. I ordered the 4 pack and only 3 of them worked. The 4th one had major major issues. Once I took the zeros of trying to set it, now the lock won't lock at all and spent an hour trying to figure out why. I finally gave up on them. Also the locks were not as easy to set as previously mentioned, two of locks would only accept certain combinations. I am not 100 percent confident in these locks. I will give them one shot when I leave out of the country soon.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar Childers

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I fly with several Pelican cases full of gear for work. I use TSA locks on my cases just as a precaution. On my first flight with these locks, two bent to the point where they were unusable, and one was no longer on the case when I picked it up at baggage claim. Now, that could have been because a TSA agent didn't re-lock the lock, or it could have broken like the other two and fallen off during the flight. Either way, these are not a good option.
customer_reviews.author: E. Christian

customer_reviews.title: These are best!
customer_reviews.text: My review of a rival lock (Acrodo) tells it all: These work, but the little red indicator goes up so you'll know that the TSA-holes got into your case. It is reset by pushing a tiny button with a paper clip wire. Which I guess TSA could do also. Then you wouldn't really know they got into your stuff. At the same time I also bought a pair of these locks from Forge (same price). Forge works similarly, but to reset the red indicator, the lock must be opened using the 3-number code you programmed into it. So TSA cannot reset it. That makes Forge a better lock IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dover

customer_reviews.title: Theft deterrent locks
customer_reviews.text: After having "someone" rummage through my suitcase, I decide to purchase a Forge TSA Lock in 2016. It's a pretty straight-forward lock and easy to use. I would suggest taking a picture of the directions first if you don't travel too much. That way you won't forget how to set the combination. As for usage, a little red button springs up when someone with a TSA key opens the lock. It's the first thing I look for when removing my suitcase from the carousel. And so far, no one has gone through my things. I purchase more locks for my parents. They like them too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good Tsa lock with indicator
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted in a tsa lock. Resetting the combination was really easy to do. Even when I had a problem with one of the locks, I contacted the manufacturer and they immediately sent me a replacement. That's some good service there. And that's standing behind your product with no hassle. Having had some old tsa locks and having multiple trips where we suspect tsa having opened our Suitcase but not leaving a notice as they're supposed to led me to want locks with indicators. I saw these and I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: stickman

customer_reviews.title: Not TSA approved
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with these locks is that they're not TSA approved. I was informed at Pangborn airport that they needed the combo for the locks to one checked bag because their key didn't open it. I found my other luggage with a zip tie in place of one of the locks when picking up from CVG baggage claim.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TSA padlocks
customer_reviews.text: Great locks, easily to set our personal combo. I read many of the reviews prior to purchasing these locks. They are small and light, but appear a good deter ant to any would be thief. The only issue is, my wife and daughter both want to use the same Colour locks. Who ever thought that since the punk era a padlock would be a fashion symbol again! But hey, at least my family wants to use them, there's half the problem gone! I just wish that they came in additional vibrant Colours, leave out the plain black and silver.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great set, worth the price and TSA Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I'll be using these on my trip to Italy and other trips where luggage security/safety could be a problem. Great for backpacks, luggage bags, purses, etc. I highly recommend these because they are TSA friendly and you don't need to fumble with remembering keys. Write the combination somewhere safe that you'll remember it. I will be using these along with my other anti-theft measures as many of the places I will be going are known for pick-pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use travel locks. TSA-accessible. Know if lock was opened.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use ... almost too easy to spin number dials. Doesn't feel as solid as pre-TSA accessible travel locks. Prefer metal hook locks to wire cable locks ... but, downside is the depth of the "U" when locked is relatively short. (For years I used one lock to close main zipper and outer-pocket zipper on my 24" travel bag. When suitcase is full now it takes a little effort to line-up all zippers perfectly so that one lock can hook through all of them.) Readers - watch videos about how easily some luggage can be unzipped. Might cause you to select different luggage as well as these locks.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I would appreciate if the locks were able to open and reset with own combo...
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the Forge TSA travel luggage Locks 4 Pack Open Alert Indicator,Zinc Alloy Body, Easy Read Dials, black, blue,green,silver when I received these items I was not able to open the locks with the zero combo -- Anybody in your office be able to assist me -how to reset the locks -- or I should return the locks & ask for my money back --- My sincere Thanks. Unfortunately this company has no feelings for their customers -- I wrote a review to have them assist me -how to correct the issue - in regards how to reset the locks to put my own combo. I will NOT purchase any more items from them...
customer_reviews.author: Ainokea

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw and other issues - stay away
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have stated, if the TSA open it and reclose it incorrectly, that lock is done for. The packaging is also not customer friendly at all. It's one of those plastic heat sealed ones that you have to wrestle with for several minutes and ends up looking absolutely destroyed. Additionally, mine arrived DIRTY and just came off unappealing. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: A Poor College Student

customer_reviews.title: Only works if TSA know how to lock it back up!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of TSA not forgetting to put the lock back on due to the key needing to be used. However our experience was that they removed the lock to inspect the suitcase, took the key out of the lock and didn't know how to lock it back up so they put the lock in the suitcase and zip tied the zippers together. Now we have a lock that can't be locked because the TSA didn't know how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TSA key cannot be removed unless the lock is re locked.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the TSA will open your lock with a TSA key and leave it open which will not allow the lock to be relocked without the TSA key. But with the Forge lock the key cannot be removed unless you re lock it .....problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Survived a plan trip to west coast- now used for YMCA locker
customer_reviews.text: They did their intended job. Both luggage locks survived a trip from Maryland to Oregon and back with out damage from inspections. They secured our luggage and wear visible and easy to spot. Custom Combination was easy to set and a nice option instead of having to remember random numbers. Since our traveling is over we use them on YMCA lockers and the kids use them for locking their book bags or situations were you need to “keep a honest person honest”. Anyone who really wants in will find a way to break the locks.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: These will be my luggage locks from now on.
customer_reviews.text: These sturdy locks might be a little heavy for some, but they do the job very well, coming in a number of colors for easy identification. Not only that but the numbers are easier to see than many other locks, which makes them a big plus for me. Changing the combinations is explained best on-line, and I recommend that because many folks probably leave them at 0-0-0, which doesn't secure your luggage much. I bought two packs for a total of four locks, and I might buy more for other luggage. I give them a five even though some folks might not like their weight. The quality, I believe, out weighs that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Delver B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cute lock, Turning the dials to the left makes the numbers go smaller.
customer_reviews.text: Update: TSA checked my checked luggage and the little red button didn't pop up. Good thing these locks are cheap. Original Review: I was able to change the code successful. You need to pull it all the way up and turn it COUNTERCLOCK WISE and press it down into the little dent. Change it to your desired code and then lift it up. I don't like that when you turn the dials to the left, the numbers get smaller. On my Masters luggage lock, turning the dials to the left, the numbers get bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Nothing's Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Code stops working- Cheap Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Warning DO NOT BUY!!! Suddenly out of nowhere the lock stopped working! My code just suddenly did not work and now I have valuables locked in a box I can't get into. Needless to say I am fuming. I hope no one has to experience this shock like I am right now. I used this everyday for almost 2 weeks. Perhaps the multiple use wore it out? Either way do not purchase this product because it will eventually break.
customer_reviews.author: queenC

customer_reviews.title: Not able to even set a new code for 3 of the 4 locks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product about a month ago for international travel. Just today opened the package to reset the lock. The directions in the package were good but as 3 of the locks would not work to reset that code went to their website to look at their video to see if I may have been doing something wrong. Followed their video and 3 of the locks DID NOT WORK with regard to resetting the code. We could turn the shackle 90 degrees and press down, no problem but could not turn an additional 90 degrees for a reset. 3 out of 4 locks Forge??? really?? DO NOT ORDER THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lock
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Swiss Key locks for several years, but they stopped locking i.e. stayed open. Keeping track of the keys was an issue, since my wife and I used these locks and had to make sure that the key was accessible when going to TSA checking. The Forge TSA locks are much more substantial, yet not too bulky. Using a combination rather than a key is an advantage as is the Open Alert Indicator. Highly recommended for someone who travels overseas for work.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great little locks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these several times over the past year and they’re great. They have metal construction and feel hefty for their size. When they arrived, they weren’t in the OEM packaging, but there was a note explaining why and also suggesting that I return them if I wasn’t happy. I obviously never returned them. Prior to these, the last locks I bought at W*****t broke after just two international trips. These, on the other hand, have some hard scuffs from rough handling, but are still 100% intact. Fantastic locks. I expect a lot more adventures with these on my bags!
customer_reviews.author: D. Glow

customer_reviews.title: I read up on the different models and this brand was highly recommended. I can see why
customer_reviews.text: I won a trip and needed locks for our suitcases. I read up on the different models and this brand was highly recommended. I can see why. These locks are super strong and durable. They were easy to configure with our codes. They opened quickly and easily when the combination was dialed in. The colors helped us identify our black luggage from all the other black luggage on the carousel. I am very happy with these locks and will continue to use them on a variety of other things that need locking, not just luggage when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Horseless

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Easy to Set
customer_reviews.text: Each lock was individually bagged then placed in a small cardboard box along with instructions. The colors are easy to notice and are pleasant to look at. Each lock was already set to 000. The instructions were easy to follow. There is a 30 second video that also explains how to set the lock on the website. The locks have a little weight on them, feel sturdy and of great quality. I bought two sets of 4 and am quite happy with my purchase so far. We will be traveling in a few days and I have no doubt these locks will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged but that's the only nice part
customer_reviews.text: It came packaged very well i was not expecting that. Each lock had it's own baggy! That's where the excitement ended. When I pulled one out of the bag I was trying to figure out if it was made of metal or plastic? The shackle is very flimsy and barely goes into the end to "lock" it. These feel like I could just pop them open with minimal force. I wish I would of checked further into them before purchasing. Just overall disappointed with the very low quality feel. These remind me of the locks you used to get out of a vending machine for .50.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice locks, good price; time will tell how they hold up.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made, came well packaged in a clear plastic clamshell. The price is good. I have not had a chance to use them yet. I like the color variety, that way no one else in the family can claim that the lock that is on their suit case is theirs, and that I must have lost mine! Only time will tell how well they hold up during travel. I was tired of having to run to the store to buy locks when ever we travel. It seems you can never find the locks when you need them. These will be kept with the suitcases, so I will at least have one ready.
customer_reviews.author: JimWorm

customer_reviews.title: No pop top, but still a very decent lock.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the locks for a recent trip. On my return trip home, there was a sticker on my bag showing that TSA opened and inspected my bag. But I was disappointed because the red button was not popped up as advertised. Other than this problem, I love the lock. I am glad that I bought the four pack. I had made a mistake in setting the combination on the first one. Make sure your combination is securedly in place when you lock it to set. I eventually got it back open. Like any combo locks, just pull tight and listen for the loud clicks.
customer_reviews.author: JKUng

customer_reviews.title: Good Luggage Locks - TSA Approved!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: • Good value 4-pack • Packaging is solid and secured • Clear instructions on how to change default combination • TSA-approved allows easy unlocking for inspection if necessary without cutting off locks • Red indicator at top displays when it has been unlocked by TSA, useful for informing travelers their baggage was inspected • Compact and durable, feels very solid with metallic body • Number dials can easily be turned and does not feel "sticky" • Number dials are clearly marked and easily readable CONS: • None
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, effortless to use and a beautiful finish
customer_reviews.text: I love these locks. I purchased these for my children to use on overnight school trips. They are effortless to turn which is great for kids. The numbers are large and easily read. My favorite aspect though is the color. The rich purple is fabulous! It stands out and has a very glossy finish. The only thing I wish I had considered when buying the 4 pack is that we have to make certain to store the locks separately. Since they are all the same color, it’s impossible to identify each person’s lock.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality lock at a less expensive price than name brand locks.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality locks. They are sturdy and solid, not plastic as others seem to be. For my daughter's luggage I purchased two locks at a brand name luggage store. Those cost almost 2X more and these Forge locks are as good as those. As a matter of fact, the shackle on these are a little thicker, but they easily fit into the zippers lock slot. Setting the combination on both locks took less than one minute. I recommend these locks to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Ray0603Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: My first test of these lock is how easy it is to set them
customer_reviews.text: Just received the locks. My first test of these lock is how easy it is to set them. I have struggled with locks of this type...the loops often don't depress or move easily to set the security code. Each of these four locks set flawlessly. The constructions appears to be strong, the colors are bright, the finish is polished, and the locks radiate an early look of quality. The "open alert" popup is a nice touch...that is typically not a regular feature in these kinds of locks. The price is just great. Now let's see how they withstand the hardships of travel!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why Lock It
customer_reviews.text: Just one more time that TSA gets to molest you and your belongings. You can change these locks combinations BUT so can TSA. Having any kind of peace of mind while traveling has been violated by TSA and their need to run their fingers through your underwear. This just permits them to show just how they can abuse their power by opening your stuff even after it has been through their microwave imaging systems.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ricket

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Well have to write that I had problems with the lock on my checked bag. Just returned from trip to Ireland. When my bag appeared at baggage claim I had a zip tie where the lock should have been. Upon opening my bag I found the lock inside. I see why they zip tied my bag, after TSA opened the lock it would not allow them to lock it again, they placed the lock inside my suitcase. So I guess I would call this a major fail!
customer_reviews.author: Florida gal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set combination
customer_reviews.text: I read most of the reviews about these locks and one negative comment was some times TSA could not remove their key when inspecting the luggage. I have some very good label tape and I put a message on label tape, with a permanent ink pen. Relock the locks in order to remove their TSA keys. ( "RELOCK TO REMOVE KEY" ) . They seem to be good locks and quick shipping. MAYBE THE LOCK MANUFACTOROR SHOULD HAVE THIS MESSAGE ON EACH LOCK.
customer_reviews.author: Rainkntry

customer_reviews.title: Handy little locks that work
customer_reviews.text: These locks do the job. It's easy to set your combination, and to reset the TSA indicator when it pops up. And a package of two is nice to get; I thought I would only need one, but of course down the line I started checking another bag, so I already had a lock for it. And the purple color stands out against the color of the bag, making it easier to pick out my bags on the luggage carousel.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Average

customer_reviews.title: Okay for travel but not secure.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay for a visual deterrent, for travel, etc. but are not secure enough to close a gym bag in a locker room for more than a minute or so. My son grabbed one of these to keep his belongings inside his gym bag while he was playing ball. Ther is enough play in the mechanism that even I (old fart) was able to determine the combination in less than a minute.
customer_reviews.author: KC Bugs

customer_reviews.title: Need special attention
customer_reviews.text: I have experienced this with 3 locks. The method for changing the combination is horrible. If it’s unlocked and the arm is turned and if numbers slighty roll or change. The combination now changed. You don’t notice and pull the lock vertical confirming the code change and now when you try to set the lock it doesn’t lock and you don’t know what the combination changed too.
customer_reviews.author: JustSaying

customer_reviews.title: The directions were easy to understand and it was a breeze to program ...
customer_reviews.text: The directions were easy to understand and it was a breeze to program the lock. I like the pop-up function that lets me know that the TSA was rummaging thru' my stuff. They are supposed to leave a note indicating that they had checked your bag but they don't always do that. The lock is heavier and more substantial than I had expected but that is a good thing. The tumblers ratchet smoothly without skipping numbers which indicates that the lock was built well. I would recommend this product if you are in the market for a travel lock.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: SUPER EASY TO READ THE DIALS
customer_reviews.text: The last locks I recently ordered were very difficult to use because the dials were chrome and the reflected light washed out the numbers. I ordered these and just received them. The dials were VERY easy to read. Once I set the dials to my own combo, they worked perfectly. What a pleasure NOT having to squint or tilt the lock to get the best angle to see the numbers on the dials. I highly recommend these locks with the updated style dials ... very easy to read them..
customer_reviews.author: DabuckTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great little lock
customer_reviews.text: These locks work great and have a place where the TSA can use a master key to open it if need be with out cutting it. I love the colors they help personalize my suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Ladywinterhawk

customer_reviews.title: Great solid lock
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the cheap one I lost in the Buffalo airport when I forgot to put it back on. This lock, especially compared to the one it is replacing, is substantially better made, and feels solid. The combo is easy to change and has enough steps in the process that you won't change it by accident. Time will tell how it holds up and it's going to be used in a couple weeks for a trip but I can already tell this will do the trick and last a long time. Well done forge.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hurwitz

customer_reviews.title: Nice locks
customer_reviews.text: I've used these locks once so far on a trip where I had a suitcase and a bike travel case. They seem to be well made although I was hoping they would have been a little studier. TSA went through my bike travel case so obviously there wasn't any issues with them opening the locks. Very simple to set the codes just be careful to follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Mtlsbl

customer_reviews.title: but I really liked the bright colors and unique style
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always purchased the “Master” luggage locks, but I really liked the bright colors and unique style. Trust me when I say “Looks aren’t everything!” I literally went to war with 2 out of the 4 locks. I never could get them to work. Needless to say,I’m sending them back
customer_reviews.author: Natjes22

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Lock
customer_reviews.text: If you can love a luggage lock, this is it. I have not traveled by air in a long time and found that things have changed. The old locks with missing keys just would not do. I loved this set because it came in four different colors. When it comes to security, color matters. Plus, they are just adorable and easy to use. My thanks to Forge LLC for putting together a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dragoness

customer_reviews.title: Locks seem sturdy; not sold in original manufacturer's packaging
customer_reviews.text: I just received the locks and found them easy to program, and they do seem very sturdy. Other than at-home testing, I haven't put them to work yet on actual flights, so I can't speak to how durable they actually end up being. It appears to me that these locks were repackaged by the seller and were not sent to me in the original manufacturer's packaging. Nevertheless, they do work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: LeRainDrop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent locks, perfect for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: These have been very easy to use during travel. So far, no issues with TSA and security checks. No keys that can be lost. My combination can't be changed easily by mistake which is very important. I've had a lock previously with a poor design which changed the combination too easily, rendering it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TSA broke my locks
customer_reviews.text: TSA broke 2 of my locks. Locks were stuck open with the red indicator popped out. I could not get the lock to function after that. TSA left the locks inside of my bag. They made it through Cincinnati TSA but were broken in Denver.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Roman

customer_reviews.title: 2 locks were defective
customer_reviews.text: We bought these 4 locks for traveling abroad for 2 weeks. When they first came, one of them didn’t work but we didn’t have time to return them as we were heading to travel the following day. So we only had three workable locks. After using them for two weeks, one of the locks stopped working. It got stuck and wouldn’t move even though we had put in the correct code. We liked the locks but we only ended up with two workable locks.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Vargas

customer_reviews.title: TSA don’t use keys
customer_reviews.text: TSA may approve these locks because they are easy to cut. Three of the locks were cut off the luggage on a recent flight. Not good for “TSA approved” locks. A waste of money. I will use zip ties in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JLee

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Luggage Locks!
customer_reviews.text: These are great little luggage locks! Fortunately my luggage wasn't searched, nor did they cut it off (I did stick a spare lock into my suitcase just in case if that happened). I liked the idea of the combination so I didn't have to worry about another key to lose while I was on vacation. The construction of these seemed really decent for the cost, pretty solid. The combination wheels were smooth as well, no dragging that I could feel. Definitely recommend to give you some peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Troy McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Geat product!!! Glad we ordered it.
customer_reviews.text: We are planning a trip in a couple of weeks and wanted protection for our luggage. The instructions to set the combination were very clear and easy to follow and look we forward to using them. One of the things that attracted us to this product was the indicator that TSA had opened our luggage. The other is the clarity of the numbers for the combination. The white on the black is very clear compared to others we reviewed. We had a bad experience last year when we did not know our luggage was opened and some of the items we brought were missing. The change in the packaging for shipping the product did not cause us any concern.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Wargaski

customer_reviews.title: Quality locks with some fresh thinking behind them
customer_reviews.text: Better than Master locks or any other luggage lock I have seen so far. Locks seems well made and sturdy. And finally, someone figured out that the old number cylinder style that has persisted for years, with shiny chrome background and tiny black numbers, can be annoying for visibility especially under some bright lights. The black background and white numbers are much better and can be viewed from any angle without worrying about reflections. What are the other lock manufacturers still thinking?!
customer_reviews.author: ceb777

customer_reviews.title: Better than many similar items
customer_reviews.text: I've had two or three similar locks and they all have the combination wheels exposed to being fractured during luggage handling. On this implementation, the wheels are protected and likely will not be broken. Also, on others it is always a question of which side the combination is to be entered. On this model, the combination clearly is set on the edge. Much better all around. Buy these, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: James S. Sobek

customer_reviews.title: Great Luggage Locks
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these luggage locks for an upcoming trip to Alaska. I like the colored locks so each person has their own color. Also, I especially liked the ability to tell if any TSA personnel opened your luggage for additional inspection. They are sturdy and well made. I highly recommend them. Yes, they are approved by TSA for luggage that will be checked on your flight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality: larger and more durable than I have seen in my local stores.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality: larger and more durable than I have seen in my local stores. This four pack is a great value and we used for our 2 checked bags and 2 carry-on bags. No problem at the airport with TSA! Actually got them for locking up luggage when left in the lobby before check-in time. And locking in the room. My teenage daughter and I had no trouble using these or unlocking them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Our First Trip Will Tell How Well They Protect
customer_reviews.text: We received the locks in time for our upcoming trip to Eastern Europe. Upon inspection we found them to be of very good quality. The new combination was easy to set. We will be taking our trip within the next few weeks and if the locks do not perform well we will update our review at that time. I don't believe that we'll have any trouble with these locks as they appear be more substantial than previous TSA approved locks have been and previous locks failed with what was "normal" baggage handling.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these locks
customer_reviews.text: These are not worth the money. I wish I had read more reviews instead of being swayed by the color. Within 24 hours from the start of my trip, 2 of the 4 locks were not usable. With the shank of the lock resting in the loop of the zipper pull, just touching the lock caused it to "lock" in the open position, making them unusable. Never had this problem before. Also, if the TSA opens the lock, it is ruined and will not work. The seller did not respond to message left on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind when traveling
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I didn't buy these a long time ago. They are simple and easy to use without having to have a key. We've traveled for so long without a lock on our luggages due to the restrictions since 911. I like how they designed these locks so that when TSA decides to inspect our checked bags out of sight, they have to actually lock it back up so that they can remove their master key and that there is the pop up indicator showing that out bags had been opened and inspected out of our sight.
customer_reviews.author: PacShore

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 out of 4 worked
customer_reviews.text: Low quality tolerance in the manufacturing, each one feels a little different. Bought this product twice. Both times, 1 out of the 4 locks broke while initially setting the code. You need to be really careful with the internal mechanism while setting the code or it may break. After successfully setting the code, we haven’t had any issues. The little red indicator that pops out if TSA used their special key on the lock worked. Gave 3 stars due to low manufacturing quality, but at least it works if you successfully set the initial code.
customer_reviews.author: Dave N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program
customer_reviews.text: Easy to program. The numbers were easy to read even in dim light. Worked well to secure our luggage. They did not get opened by the TSA on our trip but we felt secure with them on our luggage. I just wish the black and blue colors had a little more contrast to them (maybe red or orange instead of blue?). Minor details. Overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Great locks
customer_reviews.text: These were very nice locks. Easy to set up and use. I also like the feature where you can see if any agents opened your bag. I like the separate colors that come in this pack as well. If you have black luggage these locks help for easy identification while tracking down your luggage. The locks feel sturdy enough as well. Much better than my previous luggage locks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N.

customer_reviews.title: They work, but they're cheap
customer_reviews.text: Well, they won't keep someone out of your bag who wants to get in, but I know for SURE that tsa (worthless) opened my bag as the indicator was popped up, besides the notes...They're not very durable. A little difficult to set the combo, but not hard. Easy to lock, easy to open. Just don't count on them actually keeping someone out of your bag...I used it for looks...
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Gorga

customer_reviews.title: Small but solid
customer_reviews.text: These were smaller than I expected. Almost didn’t close on the attachment points on a hard sided case I was using. This size is good for securing double-zippers and such. Buy bigger locks for any larger closures. Other than having bought a size smaller than I realized, these locks worked great. Combination was easy to set, and the locks worked very well. The TSA does in fact recognize these, which sped up bag check, as I did not have to stand by until my bags cleared inspection.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found the Perfect Lock
customer_reviews.text: Perfect locks for both my range bag zipper locks, and my Pelican 1170 hard case. The tumblers are sturdy, and the visibility of the combination on the edge is a nice feature. It is almost like these locks were specifically built for the Pelican case; they fit perfectly without protruding at some odd angle out as all my previous locks had done. They fit perfectly between the handle and the case's own snap lock, and lay back flat against the case. Then, with the combination on the edge, they are easy to run the combination to open the lock. The design for setting the combination is simple, yet, unlike others, almost impossible to accidentally reset.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very secure
customer_reviews.text: When I got these locks I was worried they wouldn't fit through the zippers of our luggage, but they fit quite easily. It was easy to set a combination. After 4 flights we never had the red indicator pop up, but I'm sure that's because our bags weren't searched. Just a lot of boring clothes inside :) But it was nice having the ability to keep our belongings locked up in the hotel as well. We were very pleased with these locks. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten SH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I like these locks and I would buy them again, but I was disappointed that one of them broke on the first trip. TSA probably unlocked it and than they could not lock it again, so they put it inside the bag. I tried to fix it, but I could not.
customer_reviews.author: Ina

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for bolt cutters
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. 2 days after the return window closed, one of the locks failed at the gym. Luckily they had bolt cutters. I've used this lock 4 days a week for a month. I am careful to close the lock after each use so the combo is not accidentally changed flopping around in my bag. I was going to use on luggage this weekend.... Off to buy a new TSA approved lock.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality locks. Chunky digits and a solid selection "click" between digits. The selected combination is very conspicuous on the side of the locks, rather than the small arrows or notches that I saw in other locks. The open alert indicator works. TSA opened my bag, and left a kind note that they did, and the lock had its indicator up. Its a small thing, but I realized its a great feature that lets you know immediately once your bag comes off the carousel.
customer_reviews.author: Chadd Concepcion

customer_reviews.title: Great little locks!
customer_reviews.text: Got them for our gym lockers and luggage. These are much nicer than the Samsonite one I bought. The digits are easy to see and function smoothly. All worked and set the code as supposed to. When comparing to our Samsonite one these are heavier and obviously much better built to last. I will probably buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Joby97

customer_reviews.title: Only one small down-side
customer_reviews.text: My only trouble is that these locks cannot be engaged if the combination is not dialed in. I flew with them recently and as far as I know they did their job perfectly (my zipper didn't catch and come open which is 90% of that rating). I feel better with these on my luggage and I will use them again with confidence, I just like to dial my combination out as soon as I unlock and these locks require me to set the combination before re-engaging the lock.
customer_reviews.author: ThirdEyeFish

customer_reviews.title: One Lock Defective, One Lock Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. Was able to set the combination for one lock no problem, but the second would not reset AND the default combination no longer works. Removed one star because of this. The locks fit my luggage perfectly and are easy to use - except for the defective lock. I would love a replacement for the lock that didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Working like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Loved the deep purple color, stood out against all the black suitcases while traveling. Locked and unlocked without a glitch and easy to set the code lock, just don't forget what you set it to for the next time you travel, lol! They survived a 10 day bus tour trip with luggage being tossed around. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: good quality, not flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Actually we haven't used these yet. But, I can say the locks appear sturdy, well made, and easy to use. The "opened" indicator is a great idea. I may actually use one of these on a carry-on bag because, in reality, I dont put anything of great value in my checked luggage. But I do put in the "personal item" or carry-on. So, to keep my goods from flowing down the aisle while Im asleep, I may use one on my bag. These Forge locks give Master Lock something to shoot for.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Chambliss

customer_reviews.title: First impression is of good quality
customer_reviews.text: Construction was advertised as being solid, and it seems like a correct claim now that I have had a chance to hold them - they are heavy for their small size. I have only tested and set the new combination on them, I have not yet taken them on a trip. I thought that the bright color would aid in identifying my luggage on the carousel. I don’t think having a three rather than four digit code is likely to be a security deficit for the kind of traveling I will be doing.
customer_reviews.author: Ackelly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap locks
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Locks. My lock got jammed so I couldn't open my suitcase luckily it is TSA so I had to get them to open it, but it took a long time just to find a TSA person to open it. Wouldn't recommend this. Especially if the lock gets jammed and you are not at the airport
customer_reviews.author: Roy paynter

customer_reviews.title: The only lock I'll buy from now on!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didn't get these locks sooner! Finally a lock I can read without my readers on! I've attached a picture of my old lock (where you have to try to line up the correct numbers with the small white line) and the new lock where the numbers are easier to read and in their own column for the code. And, this new lock automatically resets the TSA red button (if they had to open the lock) but you unlocking it. No more trying to remember the secret way to reset the stupid thing. It's also feels sturdier than my previous lock.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Pitt

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: These locks seem very solid. I like that you can tell if a TSA agent has opened the lock. Great warranty. Easy to set the code and reset to another code if you feel the need. If the written instructions aren't clear check out the instruction video on the Forge web site. You'll see numbers on the end and both sides. Take note of where the instructions indicate where the actual code is to be read on the lock.
customer_reviews.author: gohogsgo

customer_reviews.title: Great travel locks!
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a 12 day vacation that included 9 flights in total and these locks worked perfectly! Each flight we checked 2 large bags and some of the time 2 smaller bags. After our first flight, we noticed the red nob on top had popped up on one of the bags, this meaning that the bag had been checked (there was a note inside from TSA as well). Worked perfectly. Knowing that our stuff was secure through out all of our travels was great!
customer_reviews.author: Punit S

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Great locks, used them on my flight to Cleveland and at the airport was asked if they were TSA locks. Had a notification on my bag that my bad had been opened- but like these locks make sure, my bags were RE-LOCKED and everything was good! I suggest buying these for any trip through the airport. Don't zip tie because if your bags get chosen to be open they will cut the zip ties and not re lock it. These force the TSA agents to re lock your bags!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie S.

customer_reviews.title: EASY to Read Numbers on the lock
customer_reviews.text: The Numbers are EASY to read on this sturdy TSA approved lock. I've purchased many different TSA luggage locks and I prefer this one most. 1) Sturdy metal construction - a little heavier than the plastic locks 2) EASY to Read numbers - LARGE BOLD White numbers on a black background Many other locks just have the numbers stamped into a silver color dial which is hard to read in bright or low light I found Forge TSA locks to be the Best
customer_reviews.author: The Worker Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great product; really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I loved the simple packaging it came in, and the amount of protection for each lock was great for shipping. In using these locks, they feel much better than past versions. I especially like the added touch of knowing if it's been unlocked by TSA. Not to mention the new design of actually seeing which numbers are showing (I didn't have a problem with that ever, but it is nice to have).
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jon

customer_reviews.title: Nice, heavy metal body
customer_reviews.text: These things are BUILT! Nice, heavy metal body, no gaps in the dials that would allow for easy picking of the locks (TSA Agent told me about that one!). I had an agent open the lock with their access key and the red pop-up indicator worked as advertised, so if TSA opens your bag(s), you are sure to know it immediately. I am ordering at least one more set of 4... for the price, you cannot beat it! I have paid $10 for a really cheap-o version of these type of locks (1 Lock!), and it was PLASTIC! This is a BARGAIN!!! Buy two!
customer_reviews.author: Lenny The Wrench

customer_reviews.title: Safety with Luggage
customer_reviews.text: So, I purchased this item last year in March 2018. Locks are still working and in great shape. TSA has been able to use the specialized key they have to access my suitcase when they want to do a search. The little red symbol is popped up so I know before open my suitcase when it's been checked. It's been great!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a couple locks in this style, and they were a bit cheesy (granted at a lower price) compared to these. They did their job, but they felt flimsy. These locks feel more robust, and setting your own combo is very easy. Spinning the dials have a better tactile feel to them so you know when you are properly aligned to the number you want. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to spot, set and use
customer_reviews.text: The purple locks are easy to spot, set and use. The one thing to note is that when traveling internationally we had 2 confiscated by the airlines even though they are TSA/airline accessible. This is not the fault of the manufacturer, but something to keep in mind. They are also great when traveling to keep on your bags in the hotel room when you are not there to secure your bags. The purple color makes it easy to spot when you open your suitcase and then throw them inside (whoops)!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L

customer_reviews.title: sturdy locks, great for checking luggage
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised! Highly recommend the locks with the metal locking loop (I thought the wire cables may be too easy to cut). I used the locks to check in a rolling duffel bag and a backpack. I felt confident the contents would be safe due to the sturdiness of these locks. They also have a feature that lets you know if they were opened by the governing transportation association (I flew internationally), by having a little red button that pops up if it was opened by the TSA and retracts when opened when using the combo set for the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Secure your luggage, backpacks, book bags.
customer_reviews.text: These locks worked well on all our luggage and backpacks. The airline said they were fine, no problem with TSA checks. I used them while leaving luggage in hotel room as well. Eliminates temptation of housekeeping to look through your things. Secure your book bag at school, if you have zipper pulls with holes. They are easy to program with your choice of 3 digit numbers. Pleased to have them while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Library Lil

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Just came home from South America and the TSA locks worked great. I did not use them going down and our bags arrived with cable ties where the locks should have been. Installed the locks for each flight in country and for the return trip home. These are good heavy duty locks and the combination dials work fine. Changing combinations is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL UNDERWOOD

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product and I am so happy I was able ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product and I am so happy I was able to buy more. The alert to open is great as you are able to know when you retrieve your luggage from the carrousel in case you need to inspect before leaving the airport. Also the smaller sized loop keeps the locks more secure with less chances of getting snagged and damaging the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Maria O. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase.  Works as advertised. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Locks and cables are exactly as advertised. Easy to set combinations. Used on golf travel bag to go to Las Vegas. No problems with TSA. They searched my bag by opening the locks and put them back on. The indicators worked as advertised. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: S. Alford

customer_reviews.title: Works locking up belongings in luggage and is approved .
customer_reviews.text: Ordered, arrived quickly, as described. Keeps most out of your personal belongings. Just hope TSA keeps secure their over ride to open . Can only hope . If they got a reason to open , just ask . This sneaking around they do is BS.. Would be better overall to ask to open and check would think .
customer_reviews.author: gh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem durable
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are clear and the combo dials easy to use. Unfortunately, the first time I tried using one for a domestic flight it disappeared between checking the bag and retrieving the bag. It was a direct flight, and there was no indication that bag had been opened by TSA or anyone else. My believe is that it couldn't stand up to the abuse my luggage took and broke off mid-journey.
customer_reviews.author: W. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Good Small Locks
customer_reviews.text: They are great little (I mean little) locks. We bought them for use on the lockers at the gym, any smaller and they would not work. One of them has locked and won't open - we spent all day going through all the combinations trying, with no success. I plan on contacting the seller to see if we can get that 1 replaced. If not, when we go to the airport next time we are going to see if we can have a TSA agent open it for us.
customer_reviews.author: DA+

customer_reviews.title: The Reason Chosen
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the color, the pack, the TSA key entry. Found the direction setting declared simple, too fast and confusing but set somehow thus reason for 3. But otherwise 4s in other categories because TSA chose to randomly select my luggage and the mechanism showed that.
customer_reviews.author: shamm

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on our trip
customer_reviews.text: These worked great on our luggage! Easy to add your own 3 digit combination. Security at the airport did not cut them off nor did they appear to have been open. We tested them several times with the key and the red indicator would pop up if the key was used to open the lock. We felt good knowing our belongings were safe and our souvenirs wouldn't be messed with on our journey home. These are a must have when traveling and TSA approved!
customer_reviews.author: CFrey

product_meta.title: Forge TSA travel luggage Locks 4 Pack Open Alert Indicator,Zinc Alloy Body, Easy Read Dials, black, blue,green,silver
feature_bullets: MOST DURABLE TSA RECOGNIZED AND ACCEPTED LOCK. Forge locks are designed from the ground up to be toughest luggage locks around. Our special alloy lock bodies, hardened steel shackles and patented internal mechanisms can take such a pounding that we back our product up with an unconditional lifetime guarantee. If you can find a way to break these locks, we’ll gladly refund or replace them.

KNOW IF YOU’VE BEEN INSPECTED. Know if an agent has opened your TSA approved lock immediately with OPEN ALERT INDICATOR. If an agent unlocks your suitcase, a RED INDICATOR will POP-UP on your lock under the steel shackle. You’ll know that your belongings were inspected and can double check that nothing is misplaced or missing while you’re still at the airport.

ALWAYS RELOCKED, ALWAYS PROTECTED. Most TSA locks on the market do not need to be re-locked by a TSA agent after their inspection is completed. With our TSA luggage lock the agent has to re-lock your suitcase to remove their key. With Forge you never worry about your suitcase locks being left open again.

NO HASSLE COMBINATION LOCKS. Set your own 3-digit combination with ease. It literally takes half a minute to enter your whatever combination you want with the detailed instructions and pictures included with the Forge TSA lock.

MANY USES WITH LOTS OF VARIETY. Forge travel locks can be used on a wide variety of items besides suitcases or luggage. These combination locks can be used on a briefcase, gym locker, purse, backpack or laptop bag.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars857 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
